result.execSummary:
The defendant Raeann J Hammer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Continue with current treatment programs already in & get into the Ruth House.

  After 1 year if there have been no problems or relapses, thhe Court may grant you an early discharge following successful completion of the conditions of this court order, adherence to the rules of your supervision, and upon the recommendation of your agent.

Credit for 1 day if probation revoked.
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Continue to make payments toward outstanding financial obligations.
.

revoked
From: GLD To: Def Re: rec'd Petition for Sentence Adjustment - Court will agian not consider petition because no accompanied by Verification of Time served

to Def   from GLD   re: CRT rec'd documents purporting to be req for sentence adjustment.  The CRT will not consider this as pet. for sent adj. because it is not accompanied by mandated Form CR261 - Verification of Time Served
Sentencing Hrg on Revocation held 4-18-18 w/ GLD - filed by Trinia Hunter

PROBATION REVOCATION
Written Explanation of determinate sentence filed
CRT: sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence 27 months
INITIAL CONFINEMENT: 15 MONTHS w/credit for 329 days
Def is eligible for CIP & ERP
EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 12 MONTHS w/cond: continue payments towards cost
from PO Emma Peterson   re: Sentencing after Revocation

3:22 pm Def in court w/ Atty Vincent Rust.  Def in custody.  Susan C Donskey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court:  This was scheduled for a drug court expulsion hearing.  Rather than proceeding through the 2nd step, It's Reann's desire to waive that step.  Is that correct Mr. Rust and Raeann?  Rust and Raeann say yes.  Court:  Then I assume the DOC will put on a hold 
COURT will grant the motion to expell and allow the expulsion from drug court.  Addresses Raeann.  You did really well when you came back from Madison.  You're capable of being clean, a good mom and a good employee..... I hope you recognize some of the estrenghts you have.  I hope you have an understanding of what it takes to stay clean...  Really trust and reach out to people and I don't see any reason you can't be successful.  You can walk out of this stronger than you came in an be successfull.  Check back in a year or year and a half and let us know how you're doing.
Vincent Rust
